text:
e="preserve">Giuseppi Logan (May 22, 1935 – April 17, 2020) was a jazz musician. He was born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He began playing with Earl Bostic and later studied at the New England Conservatory.
Logan played alto and tenor saxophone, bass clarinet, flute, piano and Pakistani oboe. He collaborated with Archie Shepp, Pharoah Sanders and Bill Dixon. Logan was a member of Byard Lancaster's band and toured with and appeared on records by Patty Waters.
Logan died on April 17, 2020 in New York City from COVID-19, aged 84.
